author: eugene bob
comment: I support the developer 100% and appreciate their efforts, but this is only mildly useful at best. I do have apex pro but my droid turbo came with Moto notification thing which takes precedence over this. So I pretty much have to scroll twice to get to apex notifier and that is an arduous task indeed. Also I'm not a big fan of this app being dependent on both apex launcher (to be expected) and DASHCLOCK (not expected) which is made by another developer. Are you guys friends/affiliates or what?
title: Kinda useful at best

author: Charles Finlay
comment: Badges show as designed for *supported applications* (listed above) after Lollipop update on my Galaxy S5.  This includes the dock.  I did a factory reset before updating to Lollipop and another after the update.  I then installed all applications.  Then I installed Apex Launcher, Apex Launcher Pro and then Apex Notifier (in that order).  External notifications are enabled in Apex Launcher.    I did have one issue with a persistent notification that showed "1" unread SMS even after I cleared all of them.  This was resolved by going into the settings for the Android "Badge Notifier" app and clearing data.  This isn't Apex related, but I see several bad reviews here attributing it to Apex, so I thought I'd mention it.
title: Notifications Work Fine on GS5 w/Lollipop for Supported Apps

author: Matt Hines
comment: I love Apex Launcher but the Apex Notifier add on is not working for me. I have allowed it to receive notifications within the app/android settings but it still doesn't work. I'm on a Sprint Samsung Galaxy Note 4 and the unread message count is not showing for the Messaging app. I am not seeing notifications on any other icon either, for missed calls or anything else. PLEASE HELP!
title: Does Not Work!!

author: Ben
comment: Design previews and options would be a good addition. I'd prefer the boxes to be wider as well, more noticeable. Also, Google recently released a new mail app to replace Gmail. It's called "Inbox for Gmail" and it doesn't seem to be supported.
title: More notification designs would be excellent

author: Teal Kintz
comment: It was working really nice for awhile, but now all of a sudden it keeps telling me I have 1 unread text message. I went through all my conversations and marked them as read, restarted my phone, and did a battery pull. Nothing has fixed it so far. :(
title: Pretty good

author: Christine Aflak
comment: With Apex, I love it because I can resize icons. However, every time I get a notification and the badge pops up, the size of the icon shrinks back down to the original size. This does not look good and is annoying as I have to redo it.
title: Works but not well

author: Stephen McBain
comment: App does not read contacts names correctly when displaying the unread messages. It either shows a random name, no even on my phone (currently 'HP Feedback' for me) or just the contacts number. Will re-rate when a fix is found
title: Does not work correctly

author: Melon Melon
comment: It'd be a lot better if there weren't two seperate settings pages in two different apps for controlling notifications. Maybe just have Apex Notifier turn them on and off and Launcher decide what to do with them and what apps. That or putting all settings in notifier and you get redirected there from" Notifications" in the Launcher settings.
title: It's confusing

author: C Matthews
comment: Used to work great but now when I read a text, the notification badge remains on the home screen and the only way to get rid of it is to restart the phone. Frustrating. May go back to stock launcher.
title: Not working

author: Lawrence Gomes
comment: Not upto the mark.  Slow to reflect theme changes. Ctheme changes pose a threat of freezing sms app, sms app fails to notify via tone. Too heavy. To many unnecessary settings. Drawer paginate settings do not comply. Apex notifier worked very well. But, closing the notifications in the shade should not remove counts. Overall needs a complete overhaul for marshmallow. Needs to be lighter.

author: David Burton
comment: I sent an email with a Support issue and got no response. Having the issue with inaccurate notifications (FaceBook) getting stuck. No response. Not good enough.
title: I wonder if this will get your attention...?

author: Ronald W
comment: When I unlock my phone I see that the little notifier is there but it disappears as soon as I unlock the phone. The missed calls notifier seems to work OK. This is on a Sony Z3 with 4.4
title: Sms notifier does not work correctly

author: Ed Williams
comment: Facebook notifications are not showing and the text msgs are showing up there. On the other hand TeslaUnread for Nova Launcher is flawless. Would rather not switch to Nova after having Apex set up but will do to get working notifications if it's my only choice. Please fix.
title: Facebook issue

author: Juan Paolo Perez
comment: But the only notification that has use to me is the messaging and phone. Since that popular apps such as twitter facebook we chat and etc are not included. I didnt know so I wasted money in buying apex pro
title: I'm happy that it works

author: Jessica W
comment: I was hoping for a notification badge like CM launcher. However this badge looks ugly and cannot change the number color. Only the background color. The color combination is so bad that I cannot even see the numbers on the notifier. Please fix it and make it better! It doesn't look anything like the pictures above!
title: Not customizable

author: dakotah2468
comment: All of you haters it works but if you have a booster app you need to put this in the exceptions so it stays on you also need an applied icon pack also creators can you please make it work for all apps
title: Good job

author: David McClelland
comment: This app is one of the main reasons I bought the pro version of Apex Launcher.  Please keep working on getting the Google Voice notifications more reliable, and please work with the CloudMagic email app team to support their app.  This works great for GMail for me, and if you need a tester for supporting either app I suggested, please let me know!
title: Great, and please keep updating this!

author: Douglas !
comment: Useless. Having too many missed texts alerts. If I go into messaging it shows the counters, but on my dock there are no notifications of what I recieved. But Apex Launcher is great. Just this extension needs fixing.

author: RH Friedman
comment: Update #3: now long pressing on screens doesn't work anymore! Can't edit icons, add apps to home screen or folders from the drawer, etc... C'MON DEVELOPERS! TELL US THAT YOU'VE GIVEN UP ON THIS APP SO WE CAN ALL MOVE ON! Update: Now down to one star, would rate zero if could! No reply for MONTHS about many issues. It was a great app until lollipop update. WTF DEV!? Back to five stars when(if) fixed
title: DEV GAVE UP ON THIS APP!!

author: Ben Hughes
comment: Same as most of the reviews, doesn't work right. Email notifier says 146 unread across 3 accounts. Would be real nice if it could separate the 3 accounts not to mention I cleared EVERY unread in all 3 accounts. It said 152 before that.
title: Just like all the other reviews

author: Paige Ellenburg
comment: I do like this app, for the most part. But we really need more options for the badges. I have a galaxy s4 and I don't have the option to see the badge on Facebook, which I really like. If this could get fixed, I would definitely give 5 stars and recommend this app.

author: Michael Zetterberg fd. Lopez
comment: Latest update of hangouts does not get a badge for new hangout messages. Using Apex Pro. Two LG G3 phones exhibit this behavior. New SMS in hangouts gets badge correctly though. Please fix
title: Hangouts v4 not working!

author: Daniel John Sanchez
comment: Used to be good, now no longer a top contender.  Works well with missed calls, SMS, and e-mail accounts. However, labs are currently not functioning properly on my Huawei P9. Main issue is that unread counts no longer appear on Hangouts, Whatsapp, etc.

author: Ellen S
comment: The Gmail app now supports other email accounts but this only notifies me of mails in the Gmail account, which is very rarely as it's not my default account. Doesn't notify of Facebook notifications either. The Nova launcher has a far superior notification app, I'll be switching back if this isn't improved soon.
title: Crap for Gmail & other apps

author: Chris Moffitt
comment: Everything else works well (Gmail, Hangouts), but I consistently have a "2" badge for my Samsung email app, even when there are no unread messages. Restarting, uninstalling, tweaking the settings all did nothing. No reply when I emailed the developer.
title: Poor integration with Samsung email app

author: Kevin McIntyre
comment: The phone calls notification shows 1 no matter what! Can't get it to go away. Other than that flaw, it's perfect!
title: Worth 5 stars except

author: Martin Tománek
comment: After last hangouts update apex notifier stopped to show badges. As mentioned before more applications would be great. Please add Hangouts support back at least
title: New hangouts doesn't work

author: AJ Jonassen
comment: This used to work with my email app (Aquamail)  but now it doesn't.   The last update stinks.   Please fix.
title: Please Fix

author: Patrick Richardson
comment: Notification counts dont work on/in foldersConsidering the author of this app is the same author as Apex launcher, i would think it more of an oversight than a limitation.
title: Not bad, one issue

author: Robin Fosse
comment: It does the job for me. However it hangs sometimes and I have to restart apex launcher to clear/refresh notifications. Would be nice to get a fix for this or at least a widget to restart it...
title: Pretty good

author: Tjarda Stienstra
comment: Most of the notification counts work OK but Gmail's adds 4 to the count. Irritating. Please fix this issue and I'll give it at least a 4.
title: Gmail count wrong

author: Wesley G
comment: Nice, although  now it says Signal has 1 unread message. I have marked everything as read, even though I know I had read all messages. Rebooted my phone and it still says I have 1 unread message.

author: Radu Mitrea
comment: Dock notifications are not displayed.Useless. Testla Unread for Nova was flawless. Also you weren't forced to uninstall and after install again when Gmail for eg was updated
title: Notifications on dock

author: André Montgomery
comment: I'd like to see this app being built into the Apex Launcher and supporting folder notification badges. Right now I have to click on my folder to actually see if an app in it has a notification. Otherwise great.

author: Dan Wheeler
comment: Had a stuck notification on my old phone, a Note 3, back in November that wouldn't go away even after a hard reset. FF to now, I have a Nexus 6p and just installed the app fresh, and still I'm getting stuck notifications.
title: Stuck notification

author: Emily Hilbrands
comment: Everything else Apex related is fantastic. This extension needs some work. Please fix!**
title: Won't acknowledge once notifications are read/viewed

author: jon blackwell
comment: Will not show notification badge on Facebook on note 4 will on tab s2 ....doubt it will get fixed looks like the developer has stopped caring about this
title: Note 4 issues

author: Cheyenne Carroll
comment: Love this app. Just move to Android from iPhone and badges are nice. Only thing not all apps supported. I use groupme and no badge. Please add it!
title: Nice to have badges

author: Marcel Hobizal
comment: After Lollipop update,  if you have issues with Email notification on docked apps,  go into the Badge Provider App and Clear Data.
title: Great app!

author: Melvyn Scott
comment: Doesn't always work, numbers are still on the icons even after deleting items from an app. Not really very useful anymore.
title: Used to be good
